comments:
Build ID: R-2.0.1-20070926042742

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Download wtp-all-in-one-sdk-R-2.0.1-20070926042742-linux-gtk.tar.gz

2. Verify with md5sum
3. Untar
4. Look at, for example, /workplace/software/eclipse/features/org.eclipse.wst.server_core.feature_2.0.1.v200709110637-2-CM8s733G3G5Jc/features.* 
Should be .xml, but is .xm.

What does the output of 'tar -tvzf wtp-all-in-one-sdk-R-2.0.1-20070926042742-linux-gtk.tar.gz eclipse/features/org.eclipse.wst.server_core.feature_2.0.1.v200709110637-2-CM8s7
33G3G5Jc/feature*' yield?  I'm seeing the correct file names.

Created an attachment (id=80062)
The output of tar tfz wtp-all-in-one-sdk-R-2.0.1-20070926042742-linux-gtk.tar.gz

egrep '\.xm$' filelist yields:
eclipse/features/org.eclipse.wst.server_core.feature_2.0.1.v200709110637-2-CM8s733G3G5Jc/feature.xm
eclipse/features/org.eclipse.wst.web_core.feature_2.0.1.v200709111200-42CK_kE77Y7ZBNCQGG/feature.xm
eclipse/features/org.eclipse.jst.webpageeditor.feature_1.0.1.v200709110605-3-29oA55P5V8A/feature.xm
eclipse/features/org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.designer.feature_1.5.1.200709261/feature.xm

And md5sum wtp-all-in-one-sdk-R-2.0.1-20070926042742-linux-gtk.tar.gz
d022ab4a8939ea781a9749ee80b71c7b wtp-all-in-one-sdk-R-2.0.1-20070926042742-linux-gtk.tar.gz

which matches the md5 on the download page.

Interestingly your eclipse/features/org.eclipse.rcp_3.3.1.R33x_r20070802-8y8eE8sEV3Fz0z0GlHJrXvTAUS/META-INF/ECLIPSE.SF
file was truncated without the 'F', and like the list of files in comment 2, it has a 101 character long path truncated to 100 even though longer paths came out just fine.  Which version of tar are you using?

tar (GNU tar) 1.13 This is a pretty vanilla RHEL-3 with all relevant updates applied. 

It seems very unlikely to be a problem with tar -- I've since downloaded the individual packages and the files with those names have come out fine.

I finally got around to looking at this, and indeed works fine for me. 

I used 
tar xvf wtp-all-in-one-sdk...

My version of tar is 
(GNU tar) 1.15.1. 

doing a google on 
tar bug 100 character limitation
will find many hits that explain the issue

I never did find one that said "fixed in version XXX" but you might just try the latest version.
